history.content:
From a colleague: "A student's native language is not English they need to fill out a Language Proficiency Questionaire: http://gsi.berkeley.edu/programs-services/language-proficiency/screening-questionnaire/. Based on the questionnaire, the language center will determine if the student needs to take an English Language exam or is exempt. It should be noted that undergrads can only be evaluated for the language exam, if a professor has expressed interest (to staff) in hiring that student as a GSI. So not all non-native-English-speaking undergrads who are interested in GSI-ing should fill out the questionnaire. Only those students who may have been told by a professor that they may be hired for a GSI." If you have more questions, please contact 
gsicoordinators@eecs.berkeley.edu

Hi, I want to ask about the Language Proficiency requirement for GSI position.

According to @2390, international students must complete the Language Proficiency Screening Questionnaire.

When I go to the application, it also asks whether I speak English as native language and requires some form of spoken English test if I don't.

Thus, I want to verify do I need those tests if I'm not an international students nor a native English speaker?
history.subject: GSI Language Proficiency requirement
